intro: Hemizonia streetsii, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Hemizonia streetsii is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
